alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:46AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Hanover and Brunswick Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 944 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over the northern half of Brunswick County and New Hanover County. These thunderstorm were drifting northeast ward at 5 mph. Very heavy rain, ponding of water on poorly drained roads and frequent lightning are possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Holden Beach, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, Johnny Mercer Pier, Figure Eight Island, North Masonboro Island, Boiling Spring Lakes, Northwest, Makatoka, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Castle Hayne and Ogden. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 414 and 416. Interstate 140 US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 19 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
